dmca.title: FW: [EV1-C2388765Z] Hello
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern: Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim. Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright. Legal Response Team THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. -----Original Message----- From: Cole Turner [mailto:turner.cole@gmail.com] Sent: Thursday, January 04, 2007 1:49 PM To: DMCA Subject: Re: FW: [EV1-C2388765Z] Hello Theplanet.com is not an official site My work is protected because it was created and fixed in a tangible form as stated on copyright.gov, a governement website: http://www.copyright.gov/help/faq/faq-general.html#mywork And what about the other copyright that was removed, from the board? Ive contacted their authors and they should be contacting you. DMCA wrote: > To Whom It May Concern: > > Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not > substantially comply with the required notification elements of the > Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA"). > > Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your > claim. > > Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright. > > Legal Response Team > THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC. > > >> -----Original Message----- >> From: Abuse@ev1servers.net [mailto:Abuse@ev1servers.net] >> Sent: Tuesday, January 02, 2007 8:31 PM >> To: DMCA >> Subject: [EV1-C2388765Z] Hello >> >> ==== Forwarded Ticket ==== >> 1. FILETIME=[781E9080:01C72D49] >> >> (multipart/alternative) >> MIME element (text/plain) >> Hello, my name is Cole Turner >> >> Recently, I was checking references to my domain, when I saw a >> referral from myrune.com >> >> While I have never heard of that site before, I went there, and I saw >> that they were using my shoutbox, which links back to my site in the >> copyright, only, I saw that the copyright was not there. >> >> They had removed the copyright from my shoutbox without permission, >> and not only that, they removed the copyright from the forum itself, >> and it also looks like the pirated the board, the blog system, and the >> > > >> gallery itself. >> While I am not the author of the forum, I contacted them, and I am >> contacting you. >> >> If you look at it from my point of view, the board alone costs $125, >> the gallery and blog system costs somewhere around $50 seperately. >> Thats a total of about $225! >> >> I tried resolving this with an administrator, only, I had a very >> immature reply. >> >> I sent them this conversation: >> >> Hello, my name is FusE >> >>> I wrote the shoutbox you are pirating on your forum, and I would >>> appreciate it if you would add back the copyright. >>> >>> Please note, this is a very serious issue, and within 3 day(s), I >>> >> must >> >>> contact your host if the issue is not resolved. >>> >>> If you wish to add back the copyright, the best and fastest way is >>> to use the update panel. >>> >>> Also, if you have not bought IPB copyright removal, you should add >>> >> the >> >>> IPB copyright back too. >>> >>> Thank You >>> >> And this is the reply that I got back: >> >> >>> Dear FusE, dang YOURSELF and SUCK COCK. >>> >>> Yours truly, >>> Your mom >>> >> To be honest, that is demoralizing and I would expect that your >> customers would be proffessional. >> >> I did not wait the three days I promised, because I received that >> personal message, and I was IP banned from the site. >> >> I wish that you would either refund or remove that customer because of >> > > >> his actions, and illegal activity that has been conducted on your >> hosting. >> >> Sincerely, >> Cole Turner >> >> MIME element (text/html) >> Hello, my name is Cole Turner

Recently, I was checking >> references to my domain, when I saw a referral from > href="http://myrune.com">myrune.com

While I have never >> heard of that site before, I went there, and I saw that they were >> using my shoutbox, which links back to my site in the copyright, only, >> > > >> I saw that the copyright was not there. >>

They had removed the copyright from my shoutbox without >> permission, and not only that, they removed the copyright from the >> forum itself,  and it also looks like the pirated the board, the >> blog system, and the gallery itself. >>
While I am not the author of the forum, I contacted them, and I am >> > > >> contacting you.

If you look at it from my point of view, the >> board alone costs $125, the gallery and blog system costs somewhere >> around $50 seperately. Thats a total of about $225! >>

I tried resolving this with an administrator, only, I had a >> very immature reply.

I sent them this >> conversation:

> class="gmail_quote"> >> Hello, my name is FusE

I wrote the shoutbox you are pirating on >> > > >> your forum, and I would appreciate it if you would add back the >> copyright.

Please note, this is a very serious issue, and >> within >> 3 day(s), I must contact your host if the issue is not resolved. >>

If you wish to add back the copyright, the best and fastest >> way is to use the update panel.

Also, if you have not bought >> IPB copyright removal, you should add the IPB copyright back >> too.

Thank You

And this is the reply that >> > > >> I got back:
> style="border-left: 1px solid rgb(204, 204, 204); margin: 0pt 0pt 0pt >> 0.8ex; padding-left: 1ex;" class="gmail_quote"> >> Dear FusE, dang >> > YOURSELF and > >> SUCK COCK.

Yours truly,
Your mom

To be >> honest, that is demoralizing and I would expect that your customers >> would be proffessional.

I did not wait the three days I >> promised, because I received that personal message, and I was IP >> banned from the site. >>

I wish that you would either refund or remove that customer >> because of his actions, and illegal activity that has been conducted >> on your hosting.

Sincerely,
Cole >> Turner


>> >> MIME element (text/plain) >> >> > > >
